intro: Calendula pluvialis, commonly known as the rain calendula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Calendula pluvialis is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
